description: Tablan + Senat - two games in one box.

Heja Sverige is a strategic level 2-player wargame set in the latter half of the 30 Years War when Sweden re-ignited the war in Germany.

Then France got involved as well and it would take 18 more years for the hostilities to end, leaving a shattered Germany in its wake when the war finally ended in 1648.

One player is the Union Player and he'll control the Factions of Sweden, France and the Protestants.

The other player is the League Player and he'll control the Factions of Spain, Bavaria and the Holy Roman Empire (HRE)

The game is played for a maximum of 9 two-year turns on a map divided into Areas controlled by the various Factions and Neutrals.

Armies consisting of Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery combat units are moved around by Generals, engage in combat and take control of Areas looking to fulfil their objectives.

—description from the designer

Rungholt, the legendary Atlantis of the North Sea, was an island with a commercial town on the North Frisian coast, which was destroyed by a storm surge in the 14th century. In this game, you try to save the island and its residents from flooding. The water masses will engross the island relentlessly – are you able to secure the town, its residents and resources to make the most points from it? Use the dice wisely and leave the island as the heroic winner!

—description from the publisher

In Chai, you will step into the shoes of a tea merchant, combining tea flavors to make a perfect blend. Specializing in either rooibos, green, oolong, black or white tea, you will buy and collect ingredients to fulfill your customers’ orders.

As a tea merchant, each turn you will do one of the following: Visit the Market, Select Additives, Reserve a Customer.

At the end of each turn, a player may complete a tea order from one customer card in their hand or visible in the customer pool. A base tea token, tea flavors and additives shown on the card are needed ingredients, and placed in an empty tea cup. The player flips over a tip and receives a coin bonus, moving the thermometer round tracker up one notch if all cups are filled.

The game ends when five rounds of cups have been fulfilled. When the final order is completed, other players complete their last turn so that each player has played the same number of turns. The player with the most victory points (from customer orders, money, and awards) wins the game as best tea merchant!

Unique features to the deluxe include:


    10 deluxe exclusive cards
    5 deluxe superfan-inspired cards
    5 wild tea ingredient tiles
    3 unique customer tips
    3 NEW ability cards

You have found the entrance to a dungeon maze, but unfortunately you don't have a map. You know that you have to find the sword and defeat the dragon to get to its treasure. But be careful, your fellow player is trying to do the same in your dungeon.  Play with the pre-build dungeons or build your own. Decide in which direction you want to go on your map, if you go the wrong way or step into a trap, it's your opponent's turn. Whoever finds the sword and the dragon first wins the game.

-description from publisher

The INC Corporation has developed an artificial intelligence that â€¨is indistinguishable from the humanoid. An international hacker â€¨organization called HaXs 4 has hacked into the corporate network, aiming to destroy the AI. As the firewall of the INC Co. you are trying to create an impenetrable network over the coding so that the HaXs 4 have no chance to realize their plans. You have to work as a team to create a big firewall network. But everyone works on their own and just share little information. Roll the dice and establish fragments into your own Mind Map to build connections between the scripts to safe the coding of the AI. Every valid connection will score points to your team. The HaXs 4 get points by deleting connections. You win the game if you have more points as the HaXs at the end.

-description from publisher

We've brought dinosaurs back to life, but who will care for these magnificent and dangerous beasts?

In Paleovet, you take the role of a paleo-veterinarian, drafting dinosaur cards from a central river, then rolling dice and spending icons for various effects, most notably curing sick and injured dinosaurs.

At the start of each turn, you remove a sleep token from each dinosaur in your hospital, which is bad, of course, as these patients need forced rest! If you have an empty bed of the four in your hospital, draft a dino from the five available, then roll your dice.

You start with three dice that show the three treatments needed to cure dinosaurs, a tranquilizer dart, and a wild icon. Spend treatment icons to heal your dinos; each one needs 1-5 treatments as depicted on their card. Any two matching icons can be used to acquire a single-use wild token or an upgrade card that provides a permanent beneficial effect; spend three matching icons to acquire more dice. If you have tranquilizers and bed space to spare, you can take more dino cards into your hospital. However, if a dinosaur isn't fully cured and has no sleep tokens on it, it wakes up and leaves the hospital — and if it's a carnivore, it takes another dinosaur with it when it goes!

Cured dinosaurs move from the hospital to your victory pile, netting you the point value on the card. When one of the three card stacks is empty, complete the round, then see who's scored the most from their veterinary efforts.

Das Festung Baues Spiel, an early 18th century military fortifications board game, comprises 52 engraved playing cards numbered sequentially. The cards use the French suits — with the suit being an image of a fortification, many rather intricate and some quite attractive — along with a paragraph of explanatory text. Along the top of the sheet additional panels list the game's rules, and a panel along the left edge contains an index of important terms. A central panel bear the "Peter Schencken" imprint against an architectural backdrop adorned with military hardware.

The sheet could be dissected for use as a traditional deck of cards or left intact for use as a board game, using the rules printed at the top. These rules appear to be fairly straightforward, involving the rolling of dice to determine one's moves, the victor being the first to land on panel number 53, the Complete Vestung ("Complete Fortification"). Additional rules add spice to the game; for example, anyone landing on panel number 16 — the Aussenwercke ("Outworks") — must sit out two turns. By progressing through all the panels, players are exposed in sequence to the various elements of fortification, from basic geometry through the digging of counter approaches.

"Dice Baseball" is a game that expresses the psychological warfare between a batter and a pitcher. It is realistic and immersive because it uses the pitcher's pitch and batter's batting method used in baseball. The batter and pitcher secretly select the card and open it at the same time. Locate the bat and the ball. If the bat matches the ball, the batter wins, the batter rolls the dice and follows the result. If the bat and the ball do not match, the pitcher wins, the pitcher rolls the dice and follows the result. Your choice can lead the team to victory!

A flicking game in the Moomin world for ages 4 and up. You try to collect fruits and berries in a jar for Moominmamma to make jam out of.

You flick a basket along the board and if it ends on a fruit field, you collect that fruit in your jar. After you have collected all 6 different fruits, you need to flick the basket inside the Moomin house at the end of the board to win. Watch out for Hattifatteners!

Krazy Maze was a 1940s board game published in Australia under licence by G. N. Raymond. National Archives Australia verifies the author being an Alan Joseph Howell and John Allan who registered the game in 1943

The game was a simple spin and move mechanism where two separate paths wind through a densely illustrated picturesque landscape. When two players play each takes a separate path. The game came with a spinner, called a "spino", which displayed numbers from 1 to 8. Players take turns spinning and moving their counter the corresponding number of squares.

Some squares on each track are marked with a letter of the alphabet and a player must follow an instruction that corresponds to that letter. For example, landing on the "A" square of the left track results in the instruction "Forgotten lunch. Back to start"; landing on the B square results in "Tiger snake on road. Extra spin to get past."

The two tracks diverge at square one and rejoin at square 89. Square 90 is the last square. A player must spin the exact number to land on square 90. The first player to do this wins.

—user summary

The famous pirate Lautikus is searching for a successor. But only the strongest pirates can win. Therefore, Lautikus invented  3 games where kids should be good in remembering, be very fast and knows what to do with words. The fastest and smartest kid wins.

On a little island, there is a huge gold treasure. Every pirate has some ducates in his boat and paddles to the island. But be careful - if a storm is coming or the captain appears, everything goes worse... The goal of the game is to be the first one on the island - with a little bit of tactics and some luck.

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Welcome, weary traveler, to Gallow Springs - the only "civilized" town on the entire Dethelm Frontier. Surrounded by bandits, predators, and cultists, only the toughest survive. If you’re going to last, you must find a source of income, purchase new gear, build shelter, recruit a posse, and protect your homestead. Do you have what it takes?

Bantam West is a competitive open-world board game with role-playing elements for 1-4 players. Begin life anew as one of four Deadly Strangers who all just arrived in the outlaw town of Gallow Springs. Spend your Grit to work, fight, build, and burn to become the most Notorious. It’s time to tell your own story...

Set in a Western sandbox, you are given total freedom to form a plan and play on your character's strengths, weaknesses, and personality to outperform the competition. Whether you live the life of a powerful merchant, an agile gunslinger, a malicious arsonist, or a stealthy thief, there is a unique way for you to come out on top! Along the way, be on the lookout for enemies and rival players who aim to fight you, burn your cabins down, and steal your hard-earned wealth!

—description from the publisher

It's spring and the ice begins to melt. The little penguins waddle from one ice floe to the other. Some floes melt too much so that the penguin has to jump into the water and start from the beginning again.
The player who manages to take all his penguins to the end of the ice floes wins.

The players draw cards with letters and tell a short story with as many words starting with this letter as possible. But caveat, the letter monster might come at every moment and catch some of the letters, before you can finish your story.

All cards are put face up on the table so that the players can see the images. One player reads an English story and the other players try to take as fast as possible the corresponding cards. A very nice game to learn a little bit of English!

The cards with the images are put face up on the table. One player tells a story about traffic rules, signs and lights which are visible on some of the cards. The player who is the first one to recognize the correct card and knows the rule, gets the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

The board game Ancient Greek City States is a turn based economic and war game, for 2 to 4 players, set during the 5thc B.C in southern Greece. The game includes 1 map of Southern Greece 32” x 36” at 8 miles to the inch, circa 5thc B.C., 1,680 economic chits, 1,960 military and control chits, 760 number counters, 3 player aids, Greek money and 4-6sided and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various city states providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the 5thc BC. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

The board game The Rise of the Iron & Steel Industry of the United States and Canada is a turn based economic game set in the late 19thc and early 20thc in the eastern USA and southern Canada. The game includes 1 map of the eastern USA and Canada 36” x 48” at 28 miles to the inch, circa 1920’s A. D., 3,200 number counters to record your sites, 50 pages of commodity charts listed by state, multiple player aids and 4-10 sided dice. Players can choose to play various sectors of the Iron and Steel industry and their related finished products providing the whole family with hours of entertainment, while learning a great deal about the actual history of the Iron & Steel industry in the late 19thc and early 20thc United States and Canada. The price does not include shipping and handling. See my website at www.bison-games.com

—description from the publisher

It's snack time!

Launch squishy frogs through The Child's mouth-to the player on the other side.  You both race to clear your side of all frogs and the first one to do so wins!

Don't take turns.  You both launch squishy frogs at the same time!

Any frogs that arrive on your side must be sent back before you can win.  So keep launching as fast as you can!

This is the way!

-description from the back of the box

"Chocim. PotÄ™ga Husarii" (Chocim. The might of the Hussars) is a wargame for 2 players, focusing on the epic battle of Chocim, fought in 1621 between the forces of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth and of the Ottoman Empire.

The struggle lasting several weeks and consisting both of pitched battles, as well as of skirmishes and siege actions ended in a stalemate and to a truce. The besieged Polish-Lithuanian forces prevailed and managed to stop a further Ottoman expansion North.

One of the players will take control of the more numerous Ottoman forces and his objective will be to break through the Polish fortifications and take control of the main Polish encampment.

The player controlling the Commonwealth forces will be defending his fortress at all costs at the same time trying to bring down enemy morale to a level at which it will refuse to keep on fighting.

If neither side achieves their objective on the battlefield before the end of the 5th turn the game is decided upon a diplomatic clash when both players will use their diplomacy assets acquired throughout the game.

"A party game for people who like to talk sh*t."

Ever wanted to tell your friends how you lost your eyebrows or about the time you had dinner with aliens? Well, now is your chance!

Take a Prompt card. Take a Word card. You now have one minute to bullsh*t a story. After the minute is up, the player next to you has to continue your story and so on!

If a player doesn't use one of the three words on the Word card, fails to complete the challenge, can't bullsh*t a story (ex. says uhhhh a lot), or gets booed, they will have to keep the Word card or Boo card.

The first player to collect three cards is a terrible bullsh*tter and the story ends. The player who is not the worst wins!

Le Jeu du Maine-et-Loire is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Maine-et-Loire, Angers, Saumur, Cholet...

Rules:
Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

Willow is a climbing game, in the style of Tichu, Tien Len, Haggis, Chimera, Fight the Landlord, The Great Dalmuti, and many others. If you’ve ever played trick-taking games like Spades or Hearts, climbing games are a little bit like that, but with poker hands instead of singles cards, and the tricks can go around the circle multiple times.

The big difference between Willow and other climbing games is that most combos stay on the table after they are played and can be 
added to (like in German Rummy). This makes it a lot easier for more players to play in more Tricks.

An eye-catching, colourful game board for the tiny ones, designed for small spaces

     Get your own safari jeep in bright yellow or blue,
     55 game cards, including
         45 wild animals waiting to be your buddies,
         2 alert cards and
         5 cards with game instructions
    


Bhutan has steep, rugged mountains and deep valleys in the North to sub-tropical forest and bamboo jungles in the South. 72% of Bhutan is dense, virgin forest. Find your buddies from those lovely wild animals who live there!

A simple game for the parent-at-home and the young one. Set out on a fun trek through the dense jungles and mountains of Bhutan!. On the way, you meet all sorts of animals. 
They will tell you where to go next: they want you to meet their friends and also leave the forest unharmed. 
Splash mud on any animal and it becomes your buddy on you jungle trail ! 
Make friends with more animals as you explore the jungle. 
In every round, you find new buddies - and they find you too! Tell your friends who you met on your trek !!

—description from the publisher

DELVE: A Solo Game Of Digging Too Deep is a solo map drawing game that puts you in control of a dwarven hold as you discover the horrors that lurk below. This roughly 32 page A5 zine has everything you need to generate natural formations, forgotten ruins, enemies, wyrd magics, and ancient monstrosities. It has a simple turn-based combat system, rules for building your hold, and tips on how to implement your hold into your RPG world.

Inspired by games like Dwarf Fortress and Dungeon Keeper, DELVE aims to capture that feeling of building and protecting a fortress in an unforgiving subterranean world.

In T34 Leader, you're in command of a Soviet armoured company of tanks, armored cars, trucks, and armoured infantry. You  may also be assigned air support and heavy weapons support in order to achieve your goals. Your goals are to take your objectives while trying to keep as many of your men alive as possible during realistic tactical missions.

T34 Leader features various historical campaigns that can be played as individual campaigns or linked to form one huge mega-campaign that follows your troops from the Invasion of Poland to the final battles on the Eastern and Western fronts.

A major part of the game is mission planning. You decide which vehicles and infantry units to use and which commanders are best for the mission. Vehicle and infantry commanders are rated for skill level and even personality quirks such as how well they keep their heads while under fire. Deciding which commanders are used for each mission is a major consideration. Your units will become fatigued with every mission. If you push a commander and his men too hard, his skills will degrade. Your commanders and their crew also gain experience with every mission. This makes for some great decision-making. Should you keep fighting with your top commanders and crew and further fatigue them to get the job done, or let the new guys fight in order to prep them for the tough missions ahead?

—description from the publisher
The game contains almost 500 questions about music, film and general knowledge.

The witch Babacadabra needs your help to find all the ingredients necessary to make her spells.
Babacadabra is a game of skill, precision and concentration, for 2-5 players aged 6 and up: a game to stimulate collaboration between the players, sorcerer’s apprentices, while developing their observation and descriptive skills. A quick and fun game, to do anywhere in minutes!

How to play
Players must cooperate and collaborate with each other in order to get hold of all the ingredients necessary for witch Babacadabra’s spell.
Taking turns, each player plays the role of the witch Babacadabra and describes to her helpers the 9 ingredients listed on her “Enchantment” card.
The other players, who play the sorcerer’s apprentices, must find the 9 ingredients in the given amount of time by looking for them among the “Ingredient” cards scattered on the table.
But beware: finding the ingredients is not an easy task because the images depict very similar objects and can therefore be confused and mixed up.

Do you have time to stop the asteroid that is heading for earth, before it is too late?

Escape room in a box.

The EXITE Box game concept combines the concrete objects and aids included in the package with the possibilities offered by the environment, the Internet and various media and means of communication. This multiplatform escape room game fits in a box, but there is much more.

Puppy Power is a free print&play 52-card puzzle game for 1 (solo) or 2 players (head to head)

The puppy's stuff is all over the place and you have to order all of it exactly right using a mancala style system.

Both players get a set of 5 Puppy Stuff cards which they put face-up in this pattern : 2 cards above the Puppy card, 1 to the right, 1 at the bottom and 1 to the left.

Both players draw an Order card.

On his turn the player must pick-up all Puppy Stuff cards from 1 Location and redistribute all the cards in a clockwise order from the Location where he picked them up.

Of the Puppy Stuff card(s) picked up in a Location, exactly 1 Puppy Stuff card must be dropped in the next Location clockwise, the next Puppy Stuff card in the next Location clockwise and so on until there are no more Puppy Stuff cards to drop

If the player's Order card pattern now matches with the Puppy Stuff cards in front of him, he has succeeded in his ordering task and that player scores the Order card by putting it to the side and drawing another Order card.

The first player to score 5 Order cards wins the game.

-description from designer

A children's game in the Hi Ho series alongside Hi Ho Cherry-O, Hi Ho Cherry-O VCR Game, Hi Ho Alphabet, and Hi Ho Color Go Round.

A VCR game about nursery rhymes with 3 different play sessions on the tape and random elements to ensure the game plays different even during the same section of the tape. Hi Ho Mother Goose contains 13 favorite nursery rhymes portrayed via puppets and cartoons. Players watch the nursery rhyme segments and listen for Mother Goose's instructions on matching cards to the rhymes and then spinning the spinner to take or give matching cards, with the player holding Mother Goose's card at the end of the session wins.

In Sketchy Ski Lifts, players are responsible for constructing a network of ski lifts to transport guests between mountain lodges.

The game takes place over 12 rounds, each representing a month of a year-long construction project. Each round, dice dictate where players may build stations and poles for their ski lifts that month. Players may also trim forests or invest in upgrades for future rounds.

Every 6 months, an Opening Day occurs where players can connect their network with cables and receive points depending on how long it takes to travel between each pair of lodges. After the second Opening Day, the winner is the player with the lowest total score.

—description from the designer

In NiezÅ‚y Blef one of the players writes down truthful answer to the drawn question. Second one presents the question and the answer to the rest. The answer presented does not have to match with original answer. All the other players decide whether it is a truth or a bluff. Players get a point if they guessed correctly. The bluffing player gets a point for each incorrect answer.

The game ends after three rounds of everyone being a crook.

—description from the publisher (translated)

WznieÅ› siÄ™ na wyÅ¼yny kreatywnoÅ›ci, by w sprytny sposób zwieÅ›Ä‡ przeciwników i zwyciÄ™Å¼yÄ‡ w tej imprezowej grze blefu i domysÅ‚ów!

Jeden z graczy zapisuje odpowiedÅº na zadane pytanie, drugi zaÅ› przedstawia jÄ… pozostaÅ‚ym uczestnikom rozgrywki. SÄ™k w tym, Å¼e jego wersja moÅ¼e, ale nie musi byÄ‡ zgodna z oryginaÅ‚em! Pozostali gracze decydujÄ…, czy ktoÅ› tu wÅ‚aÅ›nie próbuje sprowadziÄ‡ ich na manowce, czy moÅ¼e sztuczka polega na braku sztuczki…

GÅ‚osujcie!

—description from the publisher

You are the ruler of one of six alien races, each with their own special powers, which inhabit the lesser-known moons of Uranus. Until recently, your people have been living peacefully in underground dwellings to protect themselves from the noxious gases on the surface. But now you are besieged by violent and increasingly frequent asteroid attacks, which are causing irreparable damage and threatening your very existence.

Working together with the other rulers, you must rally the troops to build infrastructure and develop technologies that will protect you from the asteroids and will ultimately allow you to escape. Use your race’s special powers to help you and your neighbouring moons, which are suffering the same fate, to settle on Uranus before your moons explode.

This is a co-operative game: players work together to try to beat the game. Players win the game if they manage to get all of the moon races housed in completed modules on Uranus before the moons explode. No race must be left behind.

Each round has four phases that must be completed in order. Players play simultaneously within each phase, but wait until all players have finished a phase before moving on together to the next.

Phase 1: Asteroid track. If the asteroid track marker lands on an asteroid attack, the next attack is carried out. Areas of moons are damaged and 'go dark' making these sections unusable.

Phase 2: Mine and transport. Each mine on a player's moon produces a moon rock of the appropriate colour. The rocks are then transported along tunnel and grouped together in connected networks.

Phase 3: Use and remove. Groups of moon rocks are used together towards a single project. Progress is marked on the project board. Players may get ready to build tunnels and mines, construct launchpads and fortifications, load up their space gun or work towards developing different technologies. Each technology helps the players to progress in the game.

Phase 4: Build and activate. Completed projects can now be constructed on your moon. Mines may be built or fortified. Tunnels constructed or removed. Networks will change as your need for different groupings of resources changes.

When all players have discovered spaceship technology and habitation modules are constructed on Uranus, players may travel to Uranus. This is a race against time.

—description from the publisher

Super-Skill Pinball: Ramp it Up! is a standalone sequel to Super-Skill Pinball: 4-Cade that you can play solo, with up to four people in a single box, or with even more people with multiple copies. To play, choose one of the four unique tables and matching backglass for scorekeeping, then roll a shared pair of dice and get the pinballs rolling! You'll select one of the two die results, then move your pinball to a bumper or spinner, or target one level below with a matching number. Once you reach the lowest level, pick which flipper's roll to use to send the ball right back to the top. Play well, and you'll unlock bonuses like multiball, score multipliers, and more to help you get the high score!

Super-Skill Pinball: Ramp it Up! features these four new tables:


    Gofer Gold introduces the new extra flipper and provides a great starting point for new players! Strike it rich by panning for gold, or ride Fool's Folly into the backglass where you ride the log flume, search the lost mine, and navigate the falls!
    In Pin Pals, wrestlers enter the ring in tag-teams of two, each teammate with a slightly different table. As you play, you activate bonuses for each other and build extra multipliers when you enter the cage together. Coordination is key if you want to beat the high score!
    High Roller Heist packs all the action of a classic casino caper into two rounds, making it one of the fastest tables in Super-Skill Pinball! Recruit your crew, choose your target, and execute your plan without getting caught by security! Includes three different possible targets for your heist, each represented by a unique backglass mini-game.
    Top Speed turns your pinball into a race car and opens up an all-new challenge for experienced players with adjustable speed! Add 1, 2, or 3 to your dice rolls, building big numbers and even bigger bonuses — but if you go too fast, the flippers won't be able to stop you!

When the autumn comes and ice gets thicker, the emperor penguins go inland to mate. After partnering, the female lays one single egg. Worn out by the effort of laying the egg, the penguin mothers set out to sea to regain her strength and nourish, while the father takes care of the egg during the cold Antarctic winter.

About two and a half months later, the chicks will be born, hungry, waiting for their mother, who brings food, while their fathers provide them with heat. Soon the mothers will arrive with their belly full of fish, that will be used to feed their chicks. The fathers will now be able to run to the sea to feed after about for months of fasting.

This game is setted up at this point, where the mothers are arriving in large columns from the ocean to find their partners and chicks and feed the young and let the manes run for the fish.

To represent that, we will have a big pile of "father and chick" cards at the center of the table (grouped together to avoid the cold of the antarctica), and each player will have a bunch of "mother penguin" cards. To recognize each other, the penguins sing the songs they sang during the mating. So, to pair the couples, you will have to find which ones are singing the same song (this is: they have the same notes with the same order and color). The twist here, is that to simulate the chaos of the mothers arriving, every player will be looking for the matches at the same time in the central pile of cards!

The first player to match all his/her mothers with the partners and chicks, will win the game!

—description from the publisher

Trashed was inspired by the old-time favorite card game Garbage. With custom cards and unique twists to gameplay, Trashed takes the classic game to a whole new level. Your goal is to get your cards lined up in the right order, from 1 to 10. But, look out for the terrible Trashed card! Wild cards allow for excitingly big turns, while Stop cards will stop you in your tracks.

—description from the publisher

Animals from around the world are gathering for the hula hoop championships. Their goal is to keep up the hoop for as long as possible.

This is represented by cards. The goal is to get rid of all of your cards; or make all other players drop out ("drop their hoop").
Each player starts with five cards in their hand, plus five cards openly in front of them. When it's their turn, they can choose to play one of their open cards or one from their hand. The first player plays any card and demands the next player to play "higher" or "lower". A player can follow this, or "double" - play the same card as the player before them. Then everyone has to double (or break the double with a neighboring card or a joker. A player who cannot play drops their hoop and is out of the round.

When only one player is left, or when one player has gotten rid of all their cards, they get as many cards as have been played in that round. First player to reach 77 points wins the game.

Teams of toons square off in Looney Tunes Mayhem, each racing to be the first team to collect 5 victory points (VP).

Looney Tunes Mayhem is built around the "Mayhem System", a system for character vs. character team-based combat in which the most direct method for a team to gain VP is by KOing their opponents. Characters use items and powers to battle the enemy team, with battle damage changing each round based on the mayhem die. When a character is KOed, they are removed from the board and their opponent gains VPs, with the KOed character returning to play next round.

When you're not fighting, you might be able to gain VPs from classic cartoon locations. The "Poker Stars" location, for example, allows a toon that moves onto it to try their luck; if you roll  a star on the mayhem die, your team collects a VP immediately. The "Home Sweet Home" location gives your team a VP the first time both characters from your team arrive there. The "Desert Road" location gives out ACME deliveries, providing characters with additional effects to make their opponents go KABOOM!

The walls were lined with iron shelves, each metal slat overfilled with glass jars containing formaldehyde and grotesque curiosities within. Pristine brass tools and refined metals of a quality I had never before laid eyes upon were strewn across sturdy slabs of rock and wood, their edges sharp with use. However, my eyes were soon drawn to a sturdy writing desk, its mahogany eaves inlaid with thin strips of copper, the center of which contained a well-worn leather-bound book. My father's journal — passed down to me and representing years of knowledge and countless experiments. And inside that weathered tome, atop the pearly parchment oxidized yellow at its frayed edges, were the deliberate quill marks of a crazed genius outlining the ambitious project he could never complete in one lifetime — his masterwork.

Without realizing it, my hands were shaking as I clutched the book to my chest. At once, I felt an ownership and anxiety for the scientific sketches scrawled so eloquently on those frayed sheets. It was at that moment that I began my obsession: I would restore this laboratory to its former brilliance and dedicate my life to completing my father's work!

In My Father's Work, players are competing mad scientists entrusted with a page from their father's journal and a large estate in which to perform their devious experiments. Players earn points by completing experiments, aiding the town in its endeavors, upgrading their macabre estates, and hopefully completing their father's masterwork.

But they have to balance study and active experimentation because at the end of each generation, all of their experiments and resources are lost to time until their child begins again with only the "Journaled Knowledge and Estate" they have willed to them — and since the game is played over the course of three generations, it is inevitable that the players will rouse the townsfolk to form angry mobs or spiral into insanity from the ethically dubious works they have created. The player with the most points at the end of three generations wins and becomes the most revered, feared, ingenious scientist the world has ever known!

—description from the publisher

Includes 16 animal dice, 20 large challenge cards, 4 safari cruiser dice holder cards, Meeka Meerkat squeaker, and multilingual instructional guide
Flip a challenge card. Then all players roll their animal dice in a race to match the 4 animals on the challenge card
The first to make the matches grabs the meerkat squeezer and collects the challenge card. Collect the most challenge cards to win!
Based on the best-selling even-steven's odd game

Val de Loire Nivernais: Le jeu is an original, local and user-friendly board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Nearly 550 written questions and photos with also charades and riddles, "junior" questions which deal with subjects as varied as history or geography, heritage, local traditions, current events or famous people who have marked the Val de Loire Nivernais region.

Each player places his pawn on his commune of residence or of his choice among the 110 present on the board, from Cosne-sur-Loire to Decize via Nevers.
You will travel through the territory and have to answer questions on different themes. If the answer is correct you can replay.
To be the winner, you will have to collect 5 "Site" cards by going to their respective box and answering the question correctly.

Created as part of a design challenge to make a roll and write game using only one set of polyhedral dice, Super Roll Writer: Arcade Edition takes the action to the streets with video game-inspired combat in head-to-head and tag team modes.

Players roll their strongest dice and attempt to string together attacks, using weaker dice for rerolls as their fighter fatigues. Dice combinations resolve into strikes on various hit locations on their opponents or into defensive options such as blocking and taunting. A built-in rage meter lets fighters on the ropes turn the damage they've suffered into powerful dice mitigation and combo attacks to battle back from the brink of defeat.

—description from the designer

Immerse yourself in the hidden role game and relive the most dangerous dinner of the Occupation as a Resistant or a Collabo.
Identify your allies, gather clues to win the game before being spotted by the Gestapo.

Betrayals, turnarounds, last-minute alliances; you won't look at your friends the same way again

At the start of the game, each player is assigned a “secret role” card and a “character card”. The character card indicates the specific power of the character during the game. The role card determines which team the player is on. Either the “Collabos” team or the “Resistance” team. The "Resistance" team is always outnumbered regardless of the number of players, but its members know each other at the start of the game unlike the Collabos.
    An additional character is present on the board, the German officer. It is not played by anyone and cannot move.

Winning condition:
    In order to win the game, the Resistance must accumulate in the same hand a significant number of Resistance clues without being exposed by the Collabos. At any time of the game, even if it is not his turn, a Resident with the required number of Resistance clues, cuts his hand and wins the game with his team.
    In order to win the game, the Collabos must succeed in passing five Collabos clues to the German before the Resistance wins.

- Translation from KKBB presentation

Japanese Buddhists believe that death is followed by rebirth, a cycle they call Samusara: other Buddhists call it Samsara. This game is dedicated to that belief.

The board was inspired by polar graph paper. The rules are a bit similar to the classic game checkers.

Any opposing piece that you capture you can reincarnate as one of your pieces.
In a turn, you can either: 1) move one of your pieces one space; 2) move one piecesin a series of jumps of your and/or opponents' pieces, capturing opposing pieces as you go, or 3) resurrect any number of captured opponents pieces as your forces.

The goal in Samusara is to occupy the opponent’s power cells or the hilltop cells. You can also win by making ten capture moves.

The original publisher, Nestorgames, discontinued Samusara during tbe pandemic, among many other products (95% of his catalog, as a matter of fact), making the game out of print. Any interested puyblishers should contact me.

Game currently under testing

Roll and Rock is a 2-4 player game where players control a rock band competing to record the best album.

Roll and Rock is a worker placement game played over 12 rounds.
On each round players send their band-mates to different locations whether to learn some instrument, busking or hire new band-mates.

Grimagia is a card game where players take the role of "Grimeisters", summoners who capture monster girls using magical books called grimoires. Players win by capturing 3 of their opponents' monsters, or through eliminating each other player by reducing their HP to 0.

Players share the same 100 card deck. Each turn, a player may perform three actions: playing a monster from their hand, performing a union (combining two monsters to make one stronger monster), and capturing another player's monster using a grimoire (which works in a rock-paper-scissors fashion depending on the opposing monster's type). There are also relic cards with various effects which may be played at any time.

Afterwards, monsters may attack the other players or each other. All monsters have different stats such as health, strength, defense, and special abilities. Monsters who attack become Rested and are defenseless against attacks by other monsters until the player's next turn.

Each player has 9 pawns of 5 colors. The game board consists of squares of the same 5 colors and white squares. Each color has a strength value between 1 and 5 points. On white spaces the strength of the pawns matches their own value, on all other spaces the strength of the pawns take on the point value of the space.

Movement and capture is 1 space in any direction but not diagonally. A pawn may capture any pawn of lesser strength.

A player wins the game by eliminating all pawns of his opponent. If both players have only one pawn left, the player with the stronger pawn wins.

—user summary
